SEARCH

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
Inventory data-access layer backed by MySQL.

Responsibilities:

  • Create/verify the products table schema on startup
  • Optionally import seed data from a CSV-like text file when the table is empty
  • CRUD-style read operations and small write operations (restock, apply sale)
  • Projection queries like top-selling products

Table schema (created if missing): 

 products(
   id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   category VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
   name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
   price DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
   stock INT NOT NULL,
   sold INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0
 )

  • Constructor Details

    • Inventory

      public Inventory()
      Constructs an Inventory repo and ensures the schema exists.

      Invokes ensureSchema() which is idempotent and safe to run repeatedly.

  • Method Details

    • importFromFileIfEmpty

      public void importFromFileIfEmpty(String file)
      One-time import from a text file if and only if the products table is empty.

      Expected CSV-like format per line (header allowed, comments starting with # are ignored): 

      id,category,name,price,stock
      Non-numeric IDs or malformed lines are skipped. Existing IDs are upserted.
      Parameters:
      file - path to the seed file (e.g., products.txt)
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an IO/JDBC error occurs

    • all

      public List<Product> all()
      Retrieves all products ordered by id.
      Returns:
      list of all Product rows
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - on JDBC errors

    • find

      public Optional<Product> find(int id)
      Looks up a product by id.
      Parameters:
      id - product identifier
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the product if found; otherwise empty
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - on JDBC errors

    • restock

      public void restock(int productId, int qty)
      Increments the stock of a given product.
      Parameters:
      productId - product identifier
      qty - quantity to add (maybe negative if you intend to decrement, though not recommended)
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the product does not exist or a JDBC error occurs

    • applySale

      public void applySale(Map<Product,Integer> lines)
      Applies a sale transactionally by decrementing stock and incrementing sold for each line.
      Parameters:
      lines - map of Product to quantity sold
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - on JDBC/transaction errors

    • topSelling

      public List<Product> topSelling(int n)
      Returns the top n products sorted by sold (descending) then id (ascending).
      Parameters:
      n - maximum number of rows to return (values < 0 are treated as 0)
      Returns:
      list of top-selling products
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - on JDBC errors

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile()
      No-op because persistence is fully handled by MySQL in this implementation.

      Kept for API compatibility with the file-based version used by the console app.
